website_summaries.verdict: A great machine for those looking for a low-impact but highly effective full body workout.
pros: This stands out with its intuitive and lightweight design
As a stepping climber, it gives less impact than vertical climbers, so it's good for those who need a low-impact design
Consumers note that it moves smoothly and a solid construction
cons: Some users were disappointed that this model didn't offer resistance adjustments
A few also felt that it was noisy when in use

website_summaries.verdict: If you want an affordable step machine with an elliptical-type motion, this product is a great choice.
pros: Ultra-low impact and smooth strides makes this unit a leading choice for anyone suffering from injuries or general aches and pains
cons: Some units squeak despite oiling and retightening bolts

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy, annoying and noisy
customer_reviews.text: This is the most annoying piece of junk I’ve ever had in my life. It is extremely noisy. Do not buy this piece of junk, very disappointed! I would return it but feel bad since my poor husband worked so hard to get it put together.
customer_reviews.author: Dshrops

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.!!!!
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed.!!! In 2003 I purchased the Elite Gazelle, I loved it and I had it for many years. It was so well made. It broke and I purchased the Gazelle supreme thinking it was the best. So disappointed, it’s cheaply made. And it’s Not quiet, has annoying clicking sound. Also, had some dents and scratches on it. I give it a half of star.
customer_reviews.author: Gisela

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE!
customer_reviews.text: DON'T BUY THIS! The monitor on the screen doesn't work and the resistance only has one setting. The only part of the tracker/monitor that works is tracking my heart rate. It does not work for calories or distance (which I needed the most). Now I have to go through the difficulty of taking it apart and returning it. Customer service sucks and finding a box that fits will be impossible so do yourself a HUGE favor and don't throw away the original box.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: not nearly as good quality as the Gazelle Elite I had years ago
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected, not nearly as good quality as the Gazelle Elite I had years ago. Not as sturdy, more narrow, not as smooth, the display does not work properly for the heart rate and time, I was very disappointed in this product and would not recommend it, I will be reselling mine and getting something better.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri Pefley

customer_reviews.title: Love this Gazelle!
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy working out on this Gazelle with Tony's videos. He really makes it fun and I get a great workout for my upper and lower body. This machine is sturdy and compact. I'm getting a better workout then the Nordictrack machine because I feel more muscle soreness in both upper and lower body, plus the Gazelle is a lot more quiet to use so I can use this when family members are asleep. I also put this together myself by watching some of a you tube video on another model's assembly and the directions given.
customer_reviews.author: Lu John

customer_reviews.title: WAY Too Heavy and Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: This thing is really really heavy, takes up too much space, and you ain't getting it under most beds. When you go to fold it up it doesn't want to fold, when you try to move it without folding it up it tries to fold up, when you try to move it while it's folded up the foot pedals flap everywhere hitting everyone in the knees and shins, and I ended up crushing (and nearly breaking) my hands every time I moved and took it with me to my new apartment. Honestly? I left it by the dumpster. Waste of money unless you are a gym owner.
customer_reviews.author: J. Walker

customer_reviews.title: A fun, pain free overall aerobic workout.
customer_reviews.text: The Gazelle has been my best purchase in a very long time. You get a wonderful overall aerobic workout and it's actually fun to use. This gives you such a happy workout. I've been feeling more depressed these days - who isn't - but I get on the Gazelle, play my music and by the end I feel great. And this is the only equipment that doesn't stress in a painful way some joint or other. I missed working out under quarantine but this is wonderful. I may never go back to the gym again. Great investment.
customer_reviews.author: F.A. Hayek

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice
customer_reviews.text: This thing rocks for a non electric machine, tho I definitely recommend getting the slightly more expensive version with hydraulic resistance. It has such a variety of movements unlike a standard elliptical. I love that I can get a good arm workout, or change the motion just slightly when I'm bored with the basic movement. Keeps the 30 minutes way more interesting. Since it's more of a glider motion than the stair like motion of an elliptical, my feet sometimes ache a little from being kept flat. It folds easily, light enough for one person to move. It is a bit squeaky, but no biggie.
customer_reviews.author: kaperspec

customer_reviews.title: Great Workout at Home
customer_reviews.text: Over the years we have purchased 3 ! of these Gazelle machines. You can work up an amazing sweat and stay in shape at home. As for assembling- you need to read the directions carefully as it could be easy to get some of the pieces twisted. My very-handy husband is the one who assembles these, and when I asked him his opinion on ease of assembling he said between a 2 and 3. The product does come with little tools, but you probably will want to use your own tools: Allen wrench, socket wrench, and open-end wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Mr&Mrs

customer_reviews.title: I actually like using it, holding up very well
customer_reviews.text: I have used this almost every day for six months. It requires lubrication about once a week but that only takes a minute and it's very quiet afterward. It's not as quiet as it was on day one but it's close. It shows no signs of wear and I haven't had to change the battery in the counter. I either watch tv or listen to podcasts while on it and I don't get bored. I much prefer it to my exercise bike, which I find extremely boring. I use my fitbit with it for more reliable calories burned count. I've never worked out consistently in my life until now. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: This I my second Gazelle. I had the first one years ago. As with time, my younger years are catching up with me and I needed something that will continue to give me a challenge like running did. Enter Gazelle Supreme Step. I love the resistance added to this machine and I also like the fact that you can remove the resistance if need be. And also perfect for a beginner. I was a beginner years ago and it was easy to be compliant to an exercise program because it is fun. And putting it together was extremely easy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than I thought
customer_reviews.text: I was a little nervous ordering this because of some of the negative reviews on this but once I opened this it wasn’t to hard to assemble and when I started using it with the resistance pistons this model had me drenched in sweat within 30 minutes of using it I just received it so we’ll see how it holds up but overall it seems pretty sturdy and it’s really easy on the joints I wasn’t hurting anywhere after using it so I actually enjoyed the time spent on it and for the price it’s really not a bad investment at all
customer_reviews.author: Josh P

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Pros: *It's easy to use and seems to be fairly sturdy. *It folds up and can be slid under your bed, or leaned up against the wall when not in use. Cons: * Instructions are terrible which makes it a little hard to put together. * Screws were missing and I ended up having to search around the house to find something that would work. All in all, I do I really do enjoy the Gazelle Supreme but it could do with some improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my first Gazelle in the year 2000. I use it at least 5 days a week for 1 hour a day and I have worn out 2 units. I mean that the pistons stop working and the bushings that keep the unit quiet start go wear out. The foot slides on the second unit even began to split at the welds. I still bought a 3rd unit because I like it. It did take me 3 days to silence the squeeks and clicks. I had to trim the plastic away from the moving parts so they didn't touch. Even with all of the negitive things that i have with the unit I still would buy another one
customer_reviews.author: Gncantwell

customer_reviews.title: A good workout, but NOISY!
customer_reviews.text: So I just spent about at least an hour putting it together and then took it for a spin. After just one mile, in a fast pace, I was sweating like crazy and my heart was pumping and it said I burned 125 calories. I usually walk at a vigorous pace and never feel like this even after my 3.5 mile route, so the difference is obviously the resistance, plus probably more speed. I have bad knees, and this definitely doesn't seem to irritate them. It's just so noisy though! I had the TV on and couldn't hear a thing over the noise.
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: Buy extra bolts
customer_reviews.text: Product was easily assembled. Problem was that the bolts on the front bar continue to squeak and make noise. Two weeks into user the bolts sheared off. I had to get out tools and drill out the bolt center to insert a tap out to unscrew the broken bolt. I had to purchase metric screws at the tune of $20 just to get the unit up and operational. The days later the thing is squeaking and making nose again. I have extra bolts handy. It's a Shane because born my wife and I have lost significant weight by using.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kronos TimeMaster Ambrose

customer_reviews.title: Great Exercise Glider!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this glider! I still have one of Tony’s original gliders that I purchased in 1995 and it still works well. I needed a second one for my Lakehouse and purchased the Supreme model and it is great. It is made very well and is sturdy. IT IS NOT NOISEY as someone else mentioned. It monitors your distance, calories burned and pulse etc. It is a nice glider that works well if you do want to have an exercise routine that is easy on your knees. I am 65 yrs old and I am in good shape since I’ve been using Tony’s glider. It is fun workout. Don’t hesitate to buy it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for targeting upper and lower body muscles.
customer_reviews.text: This machine has more than met my expectations. I thought of it as a joke for many years, however using it correctly targeted more muscle groups than an expensive elliptical would. I only gave it 4 stars because the piston on the left side does not match up correctly like the one on the right but I'm not sure I'll ever use the pistons so I'm not too concerned.
customer_reviews.author: Rudean Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Works well... I dont use the resistance ...Updated 7-2019
customer_reviews.text: I originally loved this thing. It was a good workout that I could do while watching tv or listening to music. Today on 7-22-19 the crossbar just under the little computer cracked. It cracked in a way that allows the machine to slouch in the middle and causes the lower bars to hit the side legs. This same thing has happened to 2 previous edge models as well. I am in the 250lb range so I'm well under the weight limit. Not very happy having to spend 250 every 3 years on one of these. Original review... Works well...I dont use the resistance shocks tho as I would probably die in 5 minutes lol.
customer_reviews.author: BLY

customer_reviews.title: Tony Little Gazelle Glider Supreme
customer_reviews.text: I received this item the first week of November and started with 20 minutes a day. After one month I raised it to 30 minutes, and a month later to 45 minutes a day. In ten months, I have put almost 1000 miles on it and, along with a change in diet, I have lost 30 pounds. I am 72 years old and feel better than I have in years. The machine is easy to use and very low impact, so when I get off, I am tired, but not sore. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian M. Hurtado

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good
customer_reviews.text: This is fairly easy to put together. Follow the instructions and then you'll notice that you didn't get all the screws that you will need. The screws are for the cosmetic stuff so I am okay with it and the electrics need to get screws for that also. But I didn't get it for that stuff. I am just disappointed that on top of the price I had to go and buy more parts for a machine that should have come with all that.
customer_reviews.author: green fairy

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I owned the Gazelle edge for years and loved the great cardio/low impact combination. I finally decided to give the Supreme a shot...and I'm so glad I did! Assembly looked intimidating but truthfully the instructions were very clear and the packaging was simple enough which made putting it all together much more simple than I'd anticipated. As for the upgrade in machine, the hydraulics make a HUGE difference in the feel of the workout, and I love the option to lock them to the side and then attach them if needed/wanted. I couldn't be happier with the purchase, was pleased with the Amazon pricing and free shipping (Prime!) and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Keri

customer_reviews.title: Very sad because I liked gliding on this
customer_reviews.text: Within two or three months of using this--maybe 20 minutes a day--the foot pad broke off. I fixed it and it came off again. Very sad because I liked gliding on this.
customer_reviews.author: Student and Mom

customer_reviews.title: Tension
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t see an ap! It’s worth investing in the next model up to get the ability to adjust tension. The supreme only has two levels super easy and hard, no ability to work up muscle strength. Loved my first one that was a pro!
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Beware, this is very heavy!
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised that this is extremely heavy. I was looking for a device that I could easily fold away. NOT TRUE! I never took it out of the box, just returned it the next day. There are other versions of this device that are half as weighty! LIterally. If you want to set this up in one place, it's probably good. It's not portable.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyed it, but parts wear out way too fast
customer_reviews.text: Had it a year. Enjoyed it, but parts wear out way too fast. The pistons are constantly making noise, and the rubber "shock absorbers" on the rear cables wore out too quickly causing even more noise. Easy to use, fold, if they could just make the parts last longer. Getting parts for this is extremely difficult. Can't find any parts online. If you wish to wait on hold forever on the phone, (other reviews have stated this) then perhaps its possible. You would think in today's age, parts could be ordered easily and without any fuss. Wish someone would make replacement parts that were easily obtainable.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: squeeks, no bearings designed into product
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe that for the money, there are no roller or ball bearings in the unit. It is metal ring on shaft relying upon a lubricant. This is the cheap, lazy and worst way to design the couplings or rotation points. Someone else suggested a pin roller bearing in place of the metal ring, and another suggested a bike lubricant. What can't the designer do its job and properly design the product completely???
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: still in use after five years of ownership
customer_reviews.text: I still use this machine. After a hip replacement, I'm not allowed to run. This allows me to do just that. I "run" to military cadence for 20 minutes and work up a good sweat. It's a fun machine.
customer_reviews.author: andy watts

customer_reviews.title: It is difficult to assemble and would be nice if there was a photo of it on the box.
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to put bolts/screws into pre-threaded holes. I used a tap to chase the threads. Not really sturdy : uses 1/8" cables to attach steps to frame. Never could get the wheels on. It's just a low-quality, Chinese product. We bought it because my wife liked the National commercial with Tony Little skipping across the screen on a Gazelle. It's easy to use but have to keep watching the cables for signs of separation.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Laszlo (Vic)

customer_reviews.title: Great workout equipment!
customer_reviews.text: Love it, great exercise and not terrible to assemble. Very sturdy! Probably won’t use the monitor...don’t expect a high quality monitor like on a treadmill. Otherwise, fairly quiet and a great workout in front of tv. I think the price is more than fair. All tools included. If you aren’t a little mechanical, you may need some help!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Digital Display Falls Down, Wont Stay Still
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit since it claimed to have cardio sensors in the handles with the cardio display showing on a digital screen. The major problem is that the display will not stay still, keeps turning around in a circle, making the display non-visible for most of the work out. I have provided pictures that show the forward spinning motion of the black display unit.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Love the machine
customer_reviews.text: Love the machine, it was a replacement for an original gazelle that was bought when they first came out. It is much more solid than the original, but is just as smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Badger

customer_reviews.title: good sturdy machine
customer_reviews.text: Bought because I have plantar fasciitis and thought it'd be easier on my feet....I was wrong. It still hurts my feet (even standing hurts), but this machine makes it possible to get at least 20 minutes of a good workout in before I start to feel that awful pain. That's 20 minutes more than I got before. Definitely worth it, this gazelle is more sturdy and makes less noise than I expected it to be.
customer_reviews.author: MommaBear

customer_reviews.title: But I agree with other reviewers that it is difficult to assemble due to poor instructions. Used the UYouTube assemble video to figure ...
customer_reviews.text: Assembled today. Testing of the machine went well. But I agree with other reviewers that it is difficult to assemble due to poor instructions. Used the UYouTube assemble video to figure out a few things. Pleasantly pleased at how substantial it is. Hopefully it is just as durable.
customer_reviews.author: William Hague

customer_reviews.title: An awesome total body workout machine!
customer_reviews.text: This is a Great machine. I love the videos that came with it. It was fairly easy to assemble, except the monitor. It took some time to figure out. I've had no squeaking issues. The axle comes heavily greased. I wish I would have purchased it a long time ago! The gazelle supreme gives you a great total body workout.
customer_reviews.author: Susan L.

customer_reviews.title: Get the job done
customer_reviews.text: I am a pretty active person so I will have to say sometimes I do not feel like I get the work out there I get outside but it's awesome for the times that you cannot get outside I have had a couple of my friends to try it one of them has hip problems and she had no problem on it at all my mom is 70 plus years old she jumped right on it and took off overall I am happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: ccdubb6

customer_reviews.title: Easy on the knees!
customer_reviews.text: I like this product quite a bit. It's the first thing I hit in the morning before the rest of my workout. I was a runner years ago before my knee blew - and this gives me that runner's stretch without the impact. It loosens me up and builds up a bit of heat getting me ready for the day. I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Turquoise Shell

customer_reviews.title: After years of use, wife finally needed a replacement.
customer_reviews.text: My wife has used these machines since back when we started dating. Have upgraded several times over the years and last few purchases have been the supreme. It has held up the best. Does need periodic maintenance and greasing but if taken care of can last for years. Good low impact exercise, great to do while watching streaming services.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Yott

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for price
customer_reviews.text: For my first home gym purchase I was looking for something low maintenance, compact, affordable, and of course effective! I've only had this a few weeks but definitely feel that I get a decent workout. I'm neither in perfect shape nor grossly out of shape. I would definitely choose this over the the model without the resistance, otherwise it would be way too easy.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy heavy duty product
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to attach the weights to the swing arms at first. Otherwise very clear instructions. Good bolts and wrenches. Had my first Gazelle well over 20 years and passed it on. Hope this one keeps going that long as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great workouts but disappointing noise
customer_reviews.text: 125 miles done now almost a year after purchase. As other reviewers note, there are noises difficult to stop. In my machine's case, it is mainly the back left foot upper cable attachment screw. I have to retighten it and lubricate it weekly to get rid of the noise. Otherwise a great investment and great workout!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: Happy to have
customer_reviews.text: This works great! It is a good workout when I can't get outside and walk because of the weather. The bonus is I can work my arms, too! It isn't as easy to fold up as I'd hoped, but it is not impossible. The only other drawback was that I had to put a washer on the joint where the arm poles meet the foot bars. They should have been included because it started to come apart there after I'd only used it a couple of days. I haven't had any problems since.
customer_reviews.author: Adderbane

customer_reviews.title: Had problems with the monitor turning on and contacted the ...
customer_reviews.text: Had problems with the monitor turning on and contacted the company. Still have not heard back from over a month ago
customer_reviews.author: Heather Denney

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: Love it! This machine is great. It took a little assembly and some of the bars took some finagling to fit but not to hard or long to do. And it gives resistance options. The monitors are a nice addition to keep track of how far you've gone or how fast your running and what your heart rate is along with your calories burned. All in all, I would definitely buy this over again. This is a great addition to my home gym.
customer_reviews.author: Catrina

customer_reviews.title: The product is well built and sturdy but the assembly instruction is awful
customer_reviews.text: The product is well built and sturdy but the assembly instruction is awful. I thought I was a handy man but it still took me two hours to complete it. Particularly the monitor part is kind of a maze to me. I suggest it should have come with an assembly video, the one on youtube has a different model. Also, no matter how I adjust, it still squeaks a little as some reviewers complained. Oh well!
customer_reviews.author: K. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great for Winter
customer_reviews.text: I live in Alaska, so it can be pretty tough trying to run outside in the winter (mainly the dark is making it unsafe.) This allows me to at least get some form of workout after work. It's not crazy impressive with strengthening your lungs, BUT I will admit it's good for the muscles in your legs. I would see it as more of a muscular workout rather than cardio, in all. Either way, if you are just looking to get moving, this is a great tool for when you are stuck inside.
customer_reviews.author: Seabiscuit

customer_reviews.title: Fun to exercise on.
customer_reviews.text: I like this machine. I would love it if it had better lubricating options or maybe ball bearings with grease combo to help with the squeaking. When I use the Gazelle I'm on it for about an hour (I weigh around 255, 6ft tall). Even if I spray WD40 on it before hand, it will still eventually start squeaking. But that's all remedied with some loud music playing. The price was good for the quality given; would pay more if they released one that had improved squeak free parts. Overall I'm glad I purchased it since it's fun to exercise on.
customer_reviews.author: David Lee Napier

customer_reviews.title: Great workout for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have this elliptical trainer on my screened in porch for those wet days when cycling or running are just not practical. In 30 minutes, I get a good workout while enjoying the outdoors from a protected vantage point.
customer_reviews.author: danielislandvet

customer_reviews.title: Really, Really hard to move. Takes up too ...
customer_reviews.text: Really, Really hard to move. Takes up too much room. I purchased this because I had knee surgery. Did not give me the exercise that my knee needed. Going to sell it as soon as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Linda A Barnett

customer_reviews.title: A very sturdy piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: Using it to loose weight. It is not quite what I thought but I will have to get use to it. I am more use to a bigger motion than just sliding back and forth.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper2015

customer_reviews.title: Overall good product
customer_reviews.text: The assembly instruction are very vague. If you have an understanding of how to assemble things, you will figure it out. But if you like to scream and throw tools, maybe phone a friend. My biggest complaint is it is very noisy while using it. The noise comes from the hydraulic pumps. It’s bearable, but for the money this thing cost, it’s really annoying. I’m gonna take a closer look at the pumps and see if there is an adjustment I can make. Overall, good product tho.
customer_reviews.author: Marc n jenni

customer_reviews.title: Losing Weight
customer_reviews.text: I use this thing all the time. It was a great buy. It took about an hour to put together and a few of the pieces were difficult to get together correctly. If you are looking for a great exercise machine, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Put your money towards a better piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy!!! This broke after 1 year of light to moderate use. Put your money towards a better piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Chris T

customer_reviews.title: Good Unit
customer_reviews.text: I had the Gazelle Elite prior to this one, but got tiered of trying to get new parts. Not as well made as the first but also is a cheap cost. The only thing I don't like about it (over the Elite) is that there is no adjustment on the resistance pistons. You use it with or without resistance. The previous had (3) setting of progression.
customer_reviews.author: Larry D Thomas

customer_reviews.title: take your time and make sure you are aware of dangers.
customer_reviews.text: I am 83 years old and have a balance problem, the Gazelle solves it. I am trying to lose weight and can use this in 30 minutes of activities twice a day. It's very easy to use and I started at 10 minutes each time and built it up one day at a time. yes I love my Gavelle.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Shirley Forton

customer_reviews.title: I'm not an exercise fanatic
customer_reviews.text: Fanatic or not, this machine will wear you out! It's easy to use. I have knees that prevent me from using any machine where you have to bend your knees. Using the Gazelle allows me to keep in shape without being on crutches.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I had this glider exerciser quite a few years ago. It finally wore out. For years I missed my glider but was thrilled to find it again. This new model is very much improved and wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: replaced my 20 year old Gazelle with this new one ...
customer_reviews.text: replaced my 20 year old Gazelle with this new one. Here's to 20 more years of workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Collins

customer_reviews.title: WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE
customer_reviews.text: Because of heart problem, my doctor recommended me indoor excising tool. After long search I order this unit. After assembling when I started to use this machine, several grinding noises started. Monitor has juice but inoperable. I tried to reach manufacturer by phone - not responding due to COVID - 19 - also sent an email - yet no response. WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE after sale.
customer_reviews.author: ZULFIQAR K.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price and well constructed
customer_reviews.text: The directions for assembly were very easy to understand. It is sturdy and quiet. The tension option really allows you to customize it. Definitely gives you a workout similar to some body weight exercises
customer_reviews.author: Caryl Sheehan

customer_reviews.title: Feel the burn
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I love this product. I use it while watching my favorite shows. Great sweat, and legs feel the burn.
customer_reviews.author: Dynamic-Goods

customer_reviews.title: excellent total body workout Machine!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excelente no impact workout. It's really total body. It brings 3 workout videos with all techniques explanation. One of the videos show you how to assemble the machine from scratch. Also it has a workout plans, alternating aerobic days with resistance exercise. Incredible versatile machine at an excellent Price! Tony Little did a homerun with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... for last month lost very little weight but feel better need to work on a better diet for weight ...
customer_reviews.text: try to use at least 30 minutes a day up to a hour low impact on my knees for last month lost very little weight but feel better need to work on a better diet for weight loss I did lose 1" on the pants sort of a relaxing exercise with good music!!! Up date the sweaking from all the joints gets very loud .I've seen other reviews with the same problem dw40 is messy and temporary I've also tried silcone spray lubricant it's better but is also temporary anybody got a solution? Still use it daily we have 2 with same problem
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: My husband is happy with it although he says the resistance is very ...
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery. My husband is happy with it although he says the resistance is very mild. If it had several levels of resistance it would be better. It does make a click-clack noise when in use, but it does not squeak -so far!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get a great work out, that doesn't hurt.
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of these for many, many years, moved and couldn't bring it with me. Could hardly wait to get another one. Great for cardio, arms, legs, easy on the knees and ankles. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Lori P.

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive elliptical for everyday use.
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was a little difficult as the instructions and part depictions were unclear.
customer_reviews.author: thomas whalen

customer_reviews.title: good for a quick workout.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my wife who has bad joints. she doesnt use it much, but i figured thats how it would go. But its nice with the resistance, it gives your body, including upper body a good workout in just minutes.
customer_reviews.author: 77vette

customer_reviews.title: cross trainer but not cylindrical movement
customer_reviews.text: I like having it available while gyms are closed. It fold up when assembled. Hard to move for most women. There seem to be only two settings. Very easy without "pump" attached. Very hard with "pump" attached. For the price would be nice if there could be something in between these two settings.
customer_reviews.author: CeCe

customer_reviews.title: I am still not happy that you cannot get parts for these machines
customer_reviews.text: The machine is what I expected although it arrived with a dent in the bottom support frame. I am still not happy that you cannot get parts for these machines. That said, this is my second machine as it gives a good workout.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Bice

customer_reviews.title: The calorie counter you can't rely on
customer_reviews.text: I can't stand excercising but this machine makes it fun! But don't count on the calorie counter to work for it's really cheap and mine doesn't work so I just bought a step counter and hook it on my shorts so I know how many steps, and calories I burn. The machine is sturdy just the digital counter isn't.
customer_reviews.author: charlene b

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this thing. I'm around 240lbs and this thing is nice and sturdy. Not much of an exercise without the shocks hooked up and almost to much of an exercise with the shocks. I love how you can connect the shocks while still on the the machine with little effort.
customer_reviews.author: rucingthis

customer_reviews.title: Overall satisfied with this product
customer_reviews.text: Overall satisfied with this product. Performs as described. It does develop a squeak but not too awful. I have it set up in bedroom and hubby manages to sleep through it. Only other issue is i like to read while working out and there's no built-in book prop--i did however find a e-reader clamp device that, with a little bit of foam, solves this like a dream
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid machine, good workouts, great price.
customer_reviews.text: I think this machine is pretty great for the price. Was not too hard to assemble at all. Used the grease as suggested when assembling. It may give off a slightly smell but nothing bothersome. Pretty quiet so I can easily watch TV and get a great workout. I do feel like I get a really good workout session each time. No complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: Milly

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: A bit tough to put together but very solidly built and works well for impact free cardio.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Hicks

customer_reviews.title: I liked it, and especially good for those who need ...
customer_reviews.text: I liked it, and especially good for those who need to keep their weight from pounding on the treadmill. You have to use your arms to keep it moving, and I guess for that reason, I don't jump on it like I would a treadmill. But for some people, they want to use upper body strengthening as well. Nice and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: zuzyq

customer_reviews.title: BEST gazelle to buy!
customer_reviews.text: Pistons make it worth the extra. I walk hard and fast and this actually makes me work for it.
customer_reviews.author: Missy Lea

customer_reviews.title: VERY DISAPPOINTED!!!
customer_reviews.text: The box was a return from someone else. Even if they tape it like it was never open. we can tell the instructions to put it together was very limited. I have to go to you-tube and find the instructions of how to put it together. I am still disappointed by the buy.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to assemble. Screws were missing. Display function ...
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to assemble. Screws were missing. Display function only shows pulse rate, nothing else. Too difficult to move for a long enough cardio workout. Noisy.
customer_reviews.author: CHARLES G.

customer_reviews.title: Resistance is not there
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in the resistance. I would expect it would be alot more. I'm not high on the fitness level and did it doe an hour and wasn't even sweating.
customer_reviews.author: Nchada

customer_reviews.title: I like the convenience of being able to fold it up ...
customer_reviews.text: This item took me around an hour and a half to put together. I like the convenience of being able to fold it up and store it. It is also surprisingly sturdy. However, it squeaks every time I use it which can be annoying. Other than that it is a great product and if you follow the videos you will definitely start to feel the burn quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton Whetsell

customer_reviews.title: Gazelle Supreme is a great workout for the money.
customer_reviews.text: The Gazelle is really a great workout and very quiet so you can watch a TV show while working out. A half hour will pass quickly while your doing your workout and you will feel great when your done. I use mine every day and really love my Gazelle Supreme air rider.
customer_reviews.author: Duiane Dahler

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for quick in home workouts for the busy mom!
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase have been using every other day for 15 mins have noticeably lost inches and that's without using the resistance yet. Took a few times getting use to motion not like an elliptical at all. Quick put together and stow away. A little noisy when on it only because I have an infant napping when I use it. Otherwise great product!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Good quality machine but needs to be lubricated before use
customer_reviews.text: Good product with sturdy construction. Very versatile in how you use it. The main complaint I have is that other than the cross bar, it comes unlubricated, particularly the sleeve bearings on the front and back of the pedals and the cable supports. These sleeve bearings must be greased, not oiled, to keep them quiet and running smoothly, otherwise the machine will squeak and make a lot of noise. It's surprising they don't come that way. To lubricate these properly you have to remove the fastening screw or bolt. The rear back pedal bearings are challenging to reassemble because of the spring loaded plastic housing.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty Bumpkins

customer_reviews.title: we will see
customer_reviews.text: i love these, had the original one for long time. needed another one. but this one is made a bit smaller than the original one and the right cable feels like its gonna come out of its suspension. we will see.
customer_reviews.author: tessa

customer_reviews.title: I am 6'1' and weigh about 210-215 and the machine is plenty sturdy for me
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was schedule for Friday and it arrived on Tuesday afternoon. Some of the instructions were a bit unclear but assembly was not that complicated. I assembled the machine by myself in less than an hour. I have had my first 2 workouts on it and it has performed well. It is a little hard to get used to if you are used to ellipticals and treadmills/bicycles. After about 10 minutes though, you figure out the motion needed. I am 6'1' and weigh about 210-215 and the machine is plenty sturdy for me.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Gazelle good value
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality, need 2 people to assemble. Overall a very good workout that doesn't take up a lot of space.
customer_reviews.author: blewnc

customer_reviews.title: Good Unit
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and a pain to store. I do like using this as it does help mobility.
customer_reviews.author: Kent G. Stannard

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Def worth spending the extra money and getting ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Def worth spending the extra money and getting the supreme with the resistance. I have a leg injury and treadmills are too hard on my leg but the gazelle is fantastic! Great workout without being sore with pain for days after the workout!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Klinger

customer_reviews.title: This really give u a full body workout
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. Because of knees I had 2 give it up.
customer_reviews.author: "Primazon"👩‍🦱

customer_reviews.title: Electronics could be better. routed/protected better
customer_reviews.text: Electronics could be better. routed/protected better. Machine itself is surprisingly solid, tho still curious about just 2 braided cords holding it in place besides the bolted pivot on each side. Figured it would be more so reinforced. Other than that, works great.
customer_reviews.author: tB

customer_reviews.title: I use Tony's recommended warm up at my pace and before long I ...
customer_reviews.text: It is the home remedy for achieving fitness with even minimal exertion. During the times when stiffness is impairing; I use Tony's recommended warm up at my pace and before long I am loose and moving with balance and agility. I love exercising with this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Leon D

customer_reviews.title: Sigh, breaks too easily
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine i've bought 3 over the last 15 years, they break too easily and its offensive, even under weight limit and hard to get help
customer_reviews.author: Calpurrnia

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 53 year old woman with 20 extra pounds who hasn't had good, regular exercise in years. So far, so good. It really suits my strength and stamina and I have been gradually building up to longer sessions each day; to 20 minutes after the first week. That said, it is really boring, I couldn't do it if it weren't in front of the TV. Also, there's nothing super comfortable to do with your arms. The handles are too high for me and my arms wear out quickly, the bar is too low, and there's not much room to swing your arms. It's a good machine for the price though and exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Buck

customer_reviews.title: Good workout machine
customer_reviews.text: I use my machine frequently and absolutely love it! I got the better machine and have not been disappointed. Yeah, it squeaks a little bit, but that doesn't bother me as I play music while I'm exercising. I frequently adjust my focus to work more muscles by adjusting my hands and what body part is doing the work.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie

customer_reviews.title: Great for this pregnant lady!
customer_reviews.text: 9 months pregnant and still able to exercise comfortably because this machine is so easy on my joints and limbs. I get my heart rate up and am able to maintain a healthy weight. Once I've had the baby, I begin to use the power pistons to really give my body a challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Keleigh Crigler Hadley, author of Revenge Inc.

customer_reviews.title: The machine is sturdy and I'm glad I got it
customer_reviews.text: The machine is sturdy and I'm glad I got it. A good value for the price. It was not easy to put together, though, and customer service was not very helpful. I had to disassemble and reassemble the machine to get it together correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Best exercise equipment for no impact workout
customer_reviews.text: Best exercise equipment for no impact workout. No impact does not mean "no benefit." You can do some excellent cardio and toning on this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Christos

customer_reviews.title: ... for a couple weeks now and I am very happy with the decision
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the gazelle for a couple weeks now and I am very happy with the decision. It did take me about 2 hours to assemble, but I did it by myself. There were only a few times I wanted an extra pair of hands. This was well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: gunniwolf

customer_reviews.title: So far so good...
customer_reviews.text: Took my husband a bit of time to put it together - a little less than an hour. It works great, and makes a little sound but it's not annoying. It feels solid and I really enjoy it. I haven't used the resistance pistons yet, but only concern is that one of them was installed crooked and was difficult to lock into use when we assembled it.
customer_reviews.author: Munster fan

customer_reviews.title: So far So good
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the extra for the heavier model. Directions a bit vague, and nothing tightens down so the assembly option a must for those who aren't mechanically inclined. So far very happy with the machine and my wife is using it.
customer_reviews.author: WilyJohnJ

product_meta.title: Gazelle Supreme by Tony Little
product_meta.description: Our top-of-the line Gazelle Supreme delivers the ultimate low-impact workout offering 10 different exercises within one workout. The Gazelle Supreme provides both aerobic and resistance training, giving you all the benefits of stretching, walking, running, cross-country skiing, aerobic dancing and resistance training without jarring impacts or damaging movements to your body. The versatility of the Gazelle Supreme appeals to both the beginner and the advanced fitness enthusiast. Includes 3 Workout DVDs - 1) Total Body Workout 2) Tony Little's Quick Shape Workout 3) Tony Little's Ultimate Body & Mind Workout; Patented dual pivot system - allowing for a greater range of motion because your legs move independently; Soft Glide technology - this innovative technology reduces the impact on your joints; Power Pistons - hydraulic resistance delivering a more challenging workout; Grip pulse and workout computer - tracks your calories burned, distance, time, speed and pulse rate; extra-wide, non-skid foot platforms; a foldable footprint for easy storage; a maximum weight capacity of 300 pounds; a Nutrition Guide, 22 oz. water bottle + holder.
feature_bullets: Tighten and tone every major muscle group in your body
Smoothly transition from a slow walk to full run with no sudden stops
Get 10 exercises in one amazing calorie burning workout
Patented, dual-action split suspension provides a complete range of motion and freedom of movement
Soft Glide technology - innovative technology reduces the impact on your joints
